Find the general solution of the given Euler equation on $(0, \infty)$: $x^{2} y^{\prime \prime}+x y^{\prime}+y=0$

A $64 \mathrm{lb}$ object stretches a spring $4 \mathrm{ft}$ in equilibrium. It is attached to a dashpot with damping constant $c=8 \mathrm{lb}-\mathrm{sec} / \mathrm{ft}$. The object is initially displaced 18 inches above equilibrium and given a downward velocity of $4 \mathrm{ft} / \mathrm{sec}$. Find its displacement and time-varying amplitude for $t>0$.
Find the general solution: $\mathbf{y}^{\prime}=\left[\begin{array}{rr}5 & -4 \\ 10 & 1\end{array}\right] \mathbf{y}$
gt: $\mathbf{y}=c_{1} e^{3 t}\left[\begin{array}{c}\cos 6 t-3 \sin 6 t \\ 5 \cos 6 t\end{array}\right]+c_{2} e^{3 t}\left[\begin{array}{c}\sin 6 t+3 \cos 6 t \\ 5 \sin 6 t\end{array}\right]$

question: Solve the given homogeneous equation implicitly: $y^{\prime}=\frac{y}{y-2 x}$
Find the general solution: $y^{\prime \prime}+5 y^{\prime}-6 y=0$
Find the general solution: $x^{2} y^{\prime}+y=0$
Find the general solution of the given Euler equation on $(0, \infty)$: $4 x^{2} y^{\prime \prime}+8 x y^{\prime}+y=0$
Find the power series in $x$ for the general solution: $\left(1-x^{2}\right) y^{\prime \prime}-8 x y^{\prime}-12 y=0$
Find the Wronskian of a given set $\left\{y_{1}, y_{2}\right\}$ of solutions of $y^{\prime \prime}-6 y^{\prime}+9 y=0$, given that $y_{1}=e^{3 x}$.
Find the general solution: $\mathbf{y}^{\prime}=\left[\begin{array}{rr}-13 & 16 \\ -9 & 11\end{array}\right] \mathbf{y}$
Find the general solution: $4 y^{(4)}+12 y^{\prime \prime \prime}+3 y^{\prime \prime}-13 y^{\prime}-6 y=0$
Find the general solution: $\mathbf{y}^{\prime}=\frac{1}{3}\left[\begin{array}{rrr}1 & 1 & -3 \\ -4 & -4 & 3 \\ -2 & 1 & 0\end{array}\right] \mathbf{y}$
Find the general solution: $y^{\prime \prime \prime}+2 y^{\prime \prime}-y^{\prime}-2 y=e^{-2 x}[(23-2 x) \cos x+(8-9 x) \sin x]$
gt: $y=e^{-2 x}\left[\left(1+\frac{x}{2}\right) \cos x+\left(\frac{3}{2}-2 x\right) \sin x\right]+c_{1} e^{x}+c_{2} e^{-x}+c_{3} e^{-2 x}$

question: Find a fundamental set of Frobenius solutions for the equation: $3 x^{2} y^{\prime \prime}+2 x\left(1+x-2 x^{2}\right) y^{\prime}+\left(2 x-8 x^{2}\right) y=0$. Compute $a_{0}, a_{1} \ldots, a_{N}$ for $N$ at least 7 in each solution.

Find a fundamental set of Frobenius solutions for the equation: $2 x^{2}\left(1+x+x^{2}\right) y^{\prime \prime}+x\left(3+3 x+5 x^{2}\right) y^{\prime}-y=0$. Compute $a_{0}, a_{1} \ldots, a_{N}$ for $N$ at least 7 in each solution.
Find the power series in $x$ for the general solution: $\left(1+x^{2}\right) y^{\prime \prime}-10 x y^{\prime}+28 y=0$
Find the general solution of the given Euler equation on $(0, \infty)$: $x^{2} y^{\prime \prime}-x y^{\prime}+y=0$
Find a fundamental set of solutions: $4 x y^{\prime \prime}+2 y^{\prime}+y=0 ; \quad y_{1}=\sin \sqrt{x}$

Find the current in the $R L C$ circuit, assuming that $E(t)=0$ for $t>0$.
$R=3$ ohms; $L=.1$ henrys; $C=.01$ farads; $Q_{0}=0$ coulombs; $I_{0}=2$ amperes.
Find two linearly independent Frobenius solutions of the equation: $x\left(1+x^{2}\right) y^{\prime \prime}+\left(1-x^{2}\right) y^{\prime}-8 x y=0$
Find the power series in $x$ for the general solution: $\left(1+x^{2}\right) y^{\prime \prime}+2 x y^{\prime}-2 y=0$
Find the general solution of the given Euler equation on $(0, \infty)$: $x^{2} y^{\prime \prime}+3 x y^{\prime}-3 y=0$
Find the general solution: $\mathbf{y}^{\prime}=\frac{1}{3}\left[\begin{array}{rr}7 & -5 \\ 2 & 5\end{array}\right] \mathbf{y}$
gt: $\mathbf{y}=c_{1} e^{2 t}\left[\begin{array}{c}\cos t-3 \sin t \\ 2 \cos t\end{array}\right]+c_{2} e^{2 t}\left[\begin{array}{c}\sin t+3 \cos t \\ 2 \sin t\end{array}\right]$

question: Find a fundamental set of solutions: $D^{3}(D-2)^{2}\left(D^{2}+4\right)^{2} y=0$
gt: $\left\{1, x, x^{2}, e^{2 x}, x e^{2 x}, \cos 2 x, x \cos 2 x, \sin 2 x, x \sin 2 x\right\}$

question: Find the general solution: $y^{\prime \prime \prime}-4 y^{\prime \prime}+14 y^{\prime \prime}-20 y^{\prime}+25 y=e^{x}[(2+6 x) \cos 2 x+3 \sin 2 x]$
gt: $y=-\frac{x^{2} e^{x}}{16}(1+x) \cos 2 x+e^{x}\left[\left(c_{1}+c_{2} x\right) \cos 2 x+\left(c_{3}+c_{4} x\right) \sin 2 x\right]$

question: Solve the given homogeneous equation implicitly: $y^{\prime}=\frac{x y^{2}+2 y^{3}}{x^{3}+x^{2} y+x y^{2}}$
Find two linearly independent Frobenius solutions of the equation: $x^{2}(1-x) y^{\prime \prime}+x(3-2 x) y^{\prime}+(1+2 x) y=0$
Find the Wronskian $W$ of a set of four solutions of $y^{(4)}+(\tan x) y^{\prime \prime \prime}+x^{2} y^{\prime \prime}+2 x y=0$, given that $W(\pi / 4)=K$.
Find the power series in $x$ for the general solution: $\left(1+x^{2}\right) y^{\prime \prime}-8 x y^{\prime}+20 y=0$

A firefighter who weighs $192 \mathrm{lb}$ slides down an infinitely long fire pole that exerts a frictional resistive force with magnitude proportional to her speed, with constant of proportionality $k$. Find $k$, given that her terminal velocity is $-16 \mathrm{ft} / \mathrm{s}$, and then find her velocity $v$ as a function of $t$. Assume that she starts from rest.

Find a fundamental set of Frobenius solutions for the equation: $10 x^{2}\left(1+x+2 x^{2}\right) y^{\prime \prime}+x\left(13+13 x+66 x^{2}\right) y^{\prime}-\left(1+4 x+10 x^{2}\right) y=0$. Compute $a_{0}, a_{1} \ldots, a_{N}$ for $N$ at least 7 in each solution.

Find the steady state current in the circuit described by the equation.
$\frac{1}{10} Q^{\prime \prime}+2 Q^{\prime}+100 Q=3 \cos 50 t-6 \sin 50 t$

An object weighing $256 \mathrm{lb}$ is dropped from rest in a medium that exerts a resistive force with magnitude proportional to the square of the speed. The magnitude of the resisting force is $1 \mathrm{lb}$ when $|v|=4 \mathrm{ft} / \mathrm{s}$. Find $v$ for $t>0$, and find its terminal velocity.
Find the general solution: $\mathbf{y}^{\prime}=\left[\begin{array}{ll}5 & -6 \\ 3 & -1\end{array}\right] \mathbf{y}$
gt:
$\mathbf{y}=c_{1} e^{2 t}\left[\begin{array}{c}
\cos 3 t-\sin 3 t \\
\cos 3 t
\end{array}\right]+c_{2} e^{2 t}\left[\begin{array}{c}
\sin 3 t+\cos 3 t \\
\sin 3 t
\end{array}\right]$

question: A stone weighing $1 / 2 \mathrm{lb}$ is thrown upward from an initial height of $5 \mathrm{ft}$ with an initial speed of 32 $\mathrm{ft} / \mathrm{s}$. Air resistance is proportional to speed, with $k=1 / 128 \mathrm{lb}-\mathrm{s} / \mathrm{ft}$. Find the maximum height attained by the stone.

Find a fundamental set of Frobenius solutions for the equation: $4 x^{2} y^{\prime \prime}+x\left(7+2 x+4 x^{2}\right) y^{\prime}-\left(1-4 x-7 x^{2}\right) y=0$. Compute $a_{0}, a_{1} \ldots, a_{N}$ for $N$ at least 7 in each solution.
Find all curves $y=y(x)$ such that the tangent to the curve at any point passes through a given point $\left(x_{1}, y_{1}\right)$.
Find the general solution of the given Euler equation on $(0, \infty)$: $x^{2} y^{\prime \prime}+7 x y^{\prime}+8 y=0$

A $32 \mathrm{lb}$ weight stretches a spring $2 \mathrm{ft}$ in equilibrium. It is attached to a dashpot with constant $c=8$ $\mathrm{lb}-\mathrm{sec} / \mathrm{ft}$. The weight is initially displaced 8 inches below equilibrium and released from rest. Find its displacement for $t>0$.

Find the current in the $R L C$ circuit, assuming that $E(t)=0$ for $t>0$.
$R=4$ ohms; $L=.05$ henrys; $C=.008$ farads; $Q_{0}=-1$ coulombs; $I_{0}=2$ amperes.

A tank initially contains a solution of 10 pounds of salt in 60 gallons of water. Water with $1 / 2$ pound of salt per gallon is added to the tank at $6 \mathrm{gal} / \mathrm{min}$, and the resulting solution leaves at the same rate. Find the quantity $Q(t)$ of salt in the tank at time $t>0$.
Find a fundamental set of solutions: $x^{2}(\ln |x|)^{2} y^{\prime \prime}-(2 x \ln |x|) y^{\prime}+(2+\ln |x|) y=0 ; \quad y_{1}=\ln |x|$
Find the general solution: $4 x^{2} y^{\prime \prime}-4 x(x+1) y^{\prime}+(2 x+3) y=4 x^{5 / 2} e^{2 x} ; \quad y_{1}=x^{1 / 2}$
Find the general solution: $\mathbf{y}^{\prime}=\left[\begin{array}{rr}34 & 52 \\ -20 & -30\end{array}\right] \mathbf{y}$
gt: $\mathbf{y}=c_{1} e^{2 t}\left[\begin{array}{c}\sin 4 t-8 \cos 4 t \\ 5 \cos 4 t\end{array}\right]+c_{2} e^{2 t}\left[\begin{array}{c}-\cos 4 t-8 \sin 4 t \\ 5 \sin 4 t\end{array}\right]$

question: Find the general solution: $x^{2} y^{\prime \prime}+2 x(x-1) y^{\prime}+\left(x^{2}-2 x+2\right) y=x^{3} e^{2 x} ; \quad y_{1}=x e^{-x}$

Find conditions on the constants $A, B, C, D, E$, and $F$ such that the equation
$\left(A x^{2}+B x y+C y^{2}\right) d x+\left(D x^{2}+E x y+F y^{2}\right) d y=0$
is exact.
Solve the equation explicitly: $x y^{3} y^{\prime}=y^{4}+x^{4}$

A firefighter who weighs $192 \mathrm{lb}$ slides down an infinitely long fire pole that exerts a frictional resistive force with magnitude proportional to his speed, with $k=2.5 \mathrm{lb}-\mathrm{s} / \mathrm{ft}$. Assuming that he starts from rest, find his velocity as a function of time and find his terminal velocity.
Find the general solution: $y^{\prime \prime}+8 y^{\prime}+7 y=0$
Find the general solution: $y^{(4)}+8 y^{\prime \prime}-9 y=0$
Find the general solution of the given Euler equation on $(0, \infty)$: $x^{2} y^{\prime \prime}-3 x y^{\prime}+4 y=0$
Find a fundamental set of solutions: $x^{2} y^{\prime \prime}-2 x y^{\prime}+\left(x^{2}+2\right) y=0 ; \quad y_{1}=x \sin x$

An object stretches a spring 6 inches in equilibrium. Find its displacement for $t>0$ if it's initially displaced 3 inches above equilibrium and given a downward velocity of 6 inches/s. Find the frequency, period, amplitude and phase angle of the motion.
Find the power series in $x$ for the general solution: $\left(1+x^{2}\right) y^{\prime \prime}+2 x y^{\prime}+\frac{1}{4} y=0$
Find the general solution: $\mathbf{y}^{\prime}=\left[\begin{array}{rrr}-2 & -12 & 10 \\ 2 & -24 & 11 \\ 2 & -24 & 8\end{array}\right] \mathbf{y}$
gt:
\mathbf{y}=c_{1}\left[\begin{array}{r}
-2 \\
1 \\
2
\end{array}\right] e^{-6 t}+c_{2}\left(-\left[\begin{array}{l}
6 \\
1 \\
0
\end{array}\right] \frac{e^{-6 t}}{6}+\left[\begin{array}{r}
-2 \\
1 \\
2
\end{array}\right] t e^{-6 t}\right)+c_{3}\left(-\left[\begin{array}{c}
12 \\
1 \\
0
\end{array}\right] \frac{e^{-6 t}}{36}-\left[\begin{array}{l}
6 \\
1 \\
0
\end{array}\right] \frac{t e^{-6 t}}{6}+\left[\begin{array}{r}
-2 \\
1 \\
2
\end{array}\right] \frac{t^{2} e^{-6 t}}{2}\right)

question: Find the general solution: $y^{\prime \prime}+2 y^{\prime}+10 y=0$
Find the general solution: $\mathbf{y}^{\prime}=\left[\begin{array}{rrr}-3 & -1 & 0 \\ 1 & -1 & 0 \\ -1 & -1 & -2\end{array}\right] \mathbf{y}$
gt:
\mathbf{y}=c_{1}\left[\begin{array}{r}
-1 \\
0 \\
1
\end{array}\right] e^{-3 t}+c_{2}\left[\begin{array}{l}
0 \\
0 \\
1
\end{array}\right] e^{-3 t}+c_{3}\left(\left[\begin{array}{l}
1 \\
0 \\
0
\end{array}\right] e^{-3 t}+\left[\begin{array}{l}
-1 \\
-1 \\
1
\end{array}\right] t e^{-3 t}\right)

question: Find the general solution: $\mathbf{y}^{\prime}=\left[\begin{array}{rrr}-3 & -3 & 4 \\ 4 & 5 & -8 \\ 2 & 3 & -5\end{array}\right] \mathbf{y}$
Find the general solution for the equation: $y^{\prime \prime}-3 y^{\prime}+2 y=e^{3 x}(1+x)$
Suppose $y(x)=\sum_{n=0}^{\infty} a_{n}(x+1)^{n}$ on an open interval that contains $x_{0}=-1$. Find a power series in $x+1$ for $x y^{\prime \prime}+(4+2 x) y^{\prime}+(2+x) y$.
Solve the equation explicitly: $y^{\prime}=\frac{y}{x}+\sec \frac{y}{x}$

A tank initially contains 100 liters of a salt solution with a concentration of $.1 \mathrm{~g} / \mathrm{liter}$. A solution with a salt concentration of $.3 \mathrm{~g} / \mathrm{liter}$ is added to the tank at 5 liters $/ \mathrm{min}$, and the resulting mixture is drained out at the same rate. Find the concentration $K(t)$ of salt in the tank as a function of $t$.
Find the general solution of the given Euler equation on $(0, \infty)$: $x^{2} y^{\prime \prime}-3 x y^{\prime}+13 y=0$
Find a fundamental set of solutions: $x y^{\prime \prime}-(2 x+2) y^{\prime}+(x+2) y=0 ; \quad y_{1}=e^{x}$
Find the general solution: $\mathbf{y}^{\prime}=\left[\begin{array}{rr}3 & 1 \\ -1 & 1\end{array}\right] \mathbf{y}$
Find the general solution: $y^{(4)}-2 y^{\prime \prime}+y=-e^{-x}\left(4-9 x+3 x^{2}\right)$

Control mechanisms allow fluid to flow into a tank at a rate proportional to the volume $V$ of fluid in the tank, and to flow out at a rate proportional to $V^{2}$. Suppose $V(0)=V_{0}$ and the constants of proportionality are $a$ and $b$, respectively. Find $V(t)$ for $t>0$ and find $\lim _{t \rightarrow \infty} V(t)$.
Find the general solution: $x^{2} y^{\prime \prime}-5 x y^{\prime}+8 y=4 x^{2} ; \quad y_{1}=x^{2}$

Find the current in the $R L C$ circuit, assuming that $E(t)=0$ for $t>0$.
$R=6$ ohms; $L=.1$ henrys; $C=.004$ farads'; $Q_{0}=3$ coulombs; $I_{0}=-10$ amperes.
Find the general solution: $(2 x+1) y^{\prime \prime}-2 y^{\prime}-(2 x+3) y=(2 x+1)^{2} ; \quad y_{1}=e^{-x}$
Find the general solution of the given Euler equation on $(0, \infty)$: $x^{2} y^{\prime \prime}+5 x y^{\prime}+4 y=0$
Find all curves $y=y(x)$ such that the tangent to the curve at any point $\left(x_{0}, y\left(x_{0}\right)\right)$ intersects the $x$ axis at $x_{I}=x_{0}^{3}$.

A $10 \mathrm{gm}$ mass suspended on a spring moves in simple harmonic motion with period $4 \mathrm{~s}$. Find the period of the simple harmonic motion of a 20 gm mass suspended from the same spring.
Solve the equation using variation of parameters followed by separation of variables: $y^{\prime}+y=\frac{2 x e^{-x}}{1+y e^{x}}$
Find two linearly independent Frobenius solutions of the equation: $4 x^{2}(1+x) y^{\prime \prime}-4 x^{2} y^{\prime}+(1-5 x) y=0$

A tank initially contains 40 gallons of pure water. A solution with 1 gram of salt per gallon of water is added to the tank at $3 \mathrm{gal} / \mathrm{min}$, and the resulting solution drains out at the same rate. Find the quantity $Q(t)$ of salt in the tank at time $t>0$.
Find the general solution: $\mathbf{y}^{\prime}=\left[\begin{array}{rrr}-3 & 3 & 1 \\ 1 & -5 & -3 \\ -3 & 7 & 3\end{array}\right] \mathbf{y}$
gt:
$\mathbf{y}=c_{1}\left[\begin{array}{c}
-1 \\
-1 \\
1
\end{array}\right] e^{-t}+c_{2} e^{-2 t}\left[\begin{array}{c}
\cos 2 t-\sin 2 t \\
-\cos 2 t-\sin 2 t \\
2 \cos 2 t
\end{array}\right]+c_{3} e^{-2 t}\left[\begin{array}{c}
\sin 2 t+\cos 2 t \\
-\sin 2 t+\cos 2 t \\
2 \sin 2 t
\end{array}\right]$

question: Find the general solution: $y^{\prime \prime}+6 y^{\prime}+13 y=0$
Find all solutions: $x^{2} y y^{\prime}=\left(y^{2}-1\right)^{3 / 2}$
Find the general solution: $y^{\prime \prime}-2 y^{\prime}+3 y=0$

An $8 \mathrm{lb}$ weight stretches a spring 2 inches. It is attached to a dashpot with damping constant $c=4 \mathrm{lb}-\mathrm{sec} / \mathrm{ft}$. The weight is initially displaced 3 inches above equilibrium and given a downward velocity of $4 \mathrm{ft} / \mathrm{sec}$. Find its displacement for $t>0$.

A mass $m_{1}$ is suspended from a rigid support on a spring $S_{1}$ with spring constant $k_{1}$ and damping constant $c_{1}$. A second mass $m_{2}$ is suspended from the first on a spring $S_{2}$ with spring constant $k_{2}$ and damping constant $c_{2}$, and a third mass $m_{3}$ is suspended from the second on a spring $S_{3}$ with spring constant $k_{3}$ and damping constant $c_{3}$. Let $y_{1}=y_{1}(t), y_{2}=y_{2}(t)$, and $y_{3}=y_{3}(t)$ be the displacements of the three masses from their equilibrium positions at time $t$, measured positive upward. Derive a system of differential equations for $y_{1}, y_{2}$ and $y_{3}$, assuming that the masses of the springs are negligible and that vertical external forces $F_{1}, F_{2}$, and $F_{3}$ also act on the masses.

Find a fundamental set of Frobenius solutions for the equation: $8 x^{2} y^{\prime \prime}-2 x\left(3-4 x-x^{2}\right) y^{\prime}+\left(3+6 x+x^{2}\right) y=0$. Compute $a_{0}, a_{1} \ldots, a_{N}$ for $N$ at least 7 in each solution.
Find the power series in $x$ for the general solution: $\left(1-x^{2}\right) y^{\prime \prime}-5 x y^{\prime}-4 y=0$
Find a fundamental set of solutions: $\left(D^{4}-16\right)^{2} y=0$
gt: $\left\{e^{2 x}, x e^{2 x}, e^{-2 x}, x e^{-2 x}, \cos 2 x, x \cos 2 x, \sin 2 x, x \sin 2 x\right\}$

question: A cup of boiling water is placed outside at 1:00 PM. One minute later the temperature of the water is $152^{\circ} \mathrm{F}$. After another minute its temperature is $112^{\circ} \mathrm{F}$. What is the outside temperature?
Find the general solution of the given Euler equation on $(0, \infty)$: $x^{2} y^{\prime \prime}-6 y=0$

A constant horizontal force of $10 \mathrm{~N}$ pushes a $20 \mathrm{~kg}$-mass through a medium that resists its motion with $.5 \mathrm{~N}$ for every $\mathrm{m} / \mathrm{s}$ of speed. The initial velocity of the mass is $7 \mathrm{~m} / \mathrm{s}$ in the direction opposite to the direction of the applied force. Find the velocity of the mass for $t>0$.

An object with mass $m$ moves in a spiral orbit $r=c \theta^{2}$ under a central force

$$
\mathbf{F}(r, \theta)=f(r)(\cos \theta \mathbf{i}+\sin \theta \mathbf{j}) .
$$

Find $f$.
Find two linearly independent Frobenius solutions of the equation: $x^{2}\left(1+x^{2}\right) y^{\prime \prime}-x\left(1-9 x^{2}\right) y^{\prime}+\left(1+25 x^{2}\right) y=0$
Find the general solution: $\mathbf{y}^{\prime}=\left[\begin{array}{rrr}-3 & 1 & -3 \\ 4 & -1 & 2 \\ 4 & -2 & 3\end{array}\right] \mathbf{y}$
gt: $\mathbf{y}=c_{1}\left[\begin{array}{r}-1 \\ 1 \\ 1\end{array}\right] e^{t}+c_{2} e^{-t}\left[\begin{array}{c}-\sin 2 t-\cos 2 t \\ 2 \cos 2 t \\ 2 \cos 2 t\end{array}\right]+c_{3} e^{-t}\left[\begin{array}{c}\cos 2 t-\sin 2 t \\ 2 \sin 2 t \\ 2 \sin 2 t\end{array}\right]$

question: Find the general solution: $\mathbf{y}^{\prime}=\left[\begin{array}{ll}0 & -1 \\ 1 & -2\end{array}\right] \mathbf{y}$
Find the general solution: $y^{\prime \prime}-3 y^{\prime}+2 y=\frac{1}{1+e^{-x}} ; \quad y_{1}=e^{2 x}$
Solve the given homogeneous equation implicitly: $y^{\prime}=\frac{x+2 y}{2 x+y}$

Find a fundamental set of Frobenius solutions of Bessel's equation:

$$
x^{2} y^{\prime \prime}+x y^{\prime}+\left(x^{2}-v^{2}\right) y=0
$$

in the case where $v$ is a positive integer.
Find the general solution: $y^{\prime}+a y=0(a=$ constant $)$

A weight stretches a spring 6 inches in equilibrium. The weight is initially displaced 6 inches above equilibrium and given a downward velocity of $3 \mathrm{ft} / \mathrm{s}$. Find its displacement for $t>0$.
Find the general solution: $16 y^{(4)}-72 y^{\prime \prime}+81 y=0$
Find two linearly independent Frobenius solutions of the equation: $x(1+x) y^{\prime \prime}+(1-x) y^{\prime}+y=0$
Find the general solution: $27 y^{\prime \prime \prime}+27 y^{\prime \prime}+9 y^{\prime}+y=0$
Find the general solution: $x y^{\prime \prime}-(2 x+1) y^{\prime}+(x+1) y=-e^{x} ; \quad y_{1}=e^{x}$
Find the Wronskian of a given set $\left\{y_{1}, y_{2}\right\}$ of solutions of $y^{\prime \prime}-2 a y^{\prime}+a^{2} y=0$ $(a=$ constant $)$, given that $y_{1}=e^{a x}$.
Find the general solution of the given Euler equation on $(0, \infty)$: $9 x^{2} y^{\prime \prime}+15 x y^{\prime}+y=0$
Find the general solution: $y^{\prime}+3 x^{2} y=0$
Find a fundamental set of solutions: $x^{2} y^{\prime \prime}-(2 a-1) x y^{\prime}+a^{2} y=0 ; \quad y_{1}=x^{a}$
Find the general solution: $y^{\prime}+3 x^{2} y=0$
Find the general solution: $\mathbf{y}^{\prime}=\left[\begin{array}{rrr}2 & 1 & -1 \\ 0 & 1 & 1 \\ 1 & 0 & 1\end{array}\right] \mathbf{y}$
gt:
$\mathbf{y}=c_{1}\left[\begin{array}{l}
1 \\
1 \\
1
\end{array}\right] e^{2 t}+c_{2} e^{t}\left[\begin{array}{r}
-\sin t \\
\sin t \\
\cos t
\end{array}\right]+c_{3} e^{t}\left[\begin{array}{r}
\cos t \\
-\cos t \\
\sin t
\end{array}\right]$

question: Find the general solution: $y^{\prime \prime \prime}-3 y^{\prime \prime}+4 y^{\prime \prime}-2 y^{\prime}=e^{x}[(28+6 x) \cos 2 x+(11-12 x) \sin 2 x]$
Find the general solution: $x^{2} y^{\prime}+y=0$
Find the general solution: $y^{\prime \prime}-8 y^{\prime}+16 y=0$
Find the general solution: $4 y^{\prime \prime}+4 y^{\prime}+10 y=0$

A $192 \mathrm{lb}$ weight is suspended from a spring with constant $k=6 \mathrm{lb} / \mathrm{ft}$ and subjected to an external force $F(t)=8 \cos 3 t \mathrm{lb}$. Find the steady state component of the displacement for $t>0$ if the medium resists the motion with a force equal to 8 times the speed in $\mathrm{ft} / \mathrm{sec}$.
Find the power series in $x$ for the general solution: $\left(1+2 x^{2}\right) y^{\prime \prime}+7 x y^{\prime}+2 y=0$

An object with mass $m$ is given an initial velocity $v_{0} \leq 0$ in a medium that exerts a resistive force with magnitude proportional to the square of the speed. Find the velocity of the object for $t>0$, and find its terminal velocity.
gt: $v=\alpha \frac{v_{0}\left(1+e^{-\beta t}\right)-\alpha\left(1-e^{-\beta t}\right)}{\alpha\left(1+e^{-\beta t}\right)-v_{0}\left(1-e^{-\beta t}\right)} ; \quad-\alpha$, where $\alpha=\sqrt{\frac{m g}{k}}$ and $\beta=2 \sqrt{\frac{k g}{m}}$.

question:
An object with mass $m$ moves in the orbit $r=r_{0} e^{\gamma \theta}$ under a central force

$$
\mathbf{F}(r, \theta)=f(r)(\cos \theta \mathbf{i}+\sin \theta \mathbf{j}) .
$$

Find $f$.

A mass of one $\mathrm{kg}$ stretches a spring $49 \mathrm{~cm}$ in equilibrium. A dashpot attached to the spring supplies a damping force of $4 \mathrm{~N}$ for each $\mathrm{m} / \mathrm{sec}$ of speed. The mass is initially displaced $10 \mathrm{~cm}$ above equilibrium and given a downward velocity of $1 \mathrm{~m} / \mathrm{sec}$. Find its displacement for $t>0$.
Find the Wronskian of a given set $\left\{y_{1}, y_{2}\right\}$ of solutions of $x^{2} y^{\prime \prime}+x y^{\prime}-y=0$, given that $y_{1}=x$.
Find the general solution: $(1-2 x) y^{\prime \prime}+2 y^{\prime}+(2 x-3) y=\left(1-4 x+4 x^{2}\right) e^{x} ; \quad y_{1}=e^{x}$

A $32 \mathrm{lb}$ weight stretches a spring $1 \mathrm{ft}$ in equilibrium. The weight is initially displaced 6 inches above equilibrium and given a downward velocity of $3 \mathrm{ft} / \mathrm{sec}$. Find its displacement for $t>0$ if the medium resists the motion with a force equal to 3 times the speed in $\mathrm{ft} / \mathrm{sec}$.
Suppose $y(x)=\sum_{n=0}^{\infty} a_{n}(x-2)^{n}$ on an open interval that contains $x_{0}=2$. Find a power series in $x-2$ for $x^{2} y^{\prime \prime}+2 x y^{\prime}-3 x y$.
Find the general solution for the equation: $y^{\prime \prime}-2 y^{\prime}+y=e^{x}(2-12 x)$
Find the general solution: $4 x^{2} y^{\prime \prime}+\left(4 x-8 x^{2}\right) y^{\prime}+\left(4 x^{2}-4 x-1\right) y=4 x^{1 / 2} e^{x}(1+4 x) ; \quad y_{1}=x^{1 / 2} e^{x}$

A $64 \mathrm{lb}$ weight is suspended from a spring with constant $k=25 \mathrm{lb} / \mathrm{ft}$. It is initially displaced 18 inches above equilibrium and released from rest. Find its displacement for $t>0$ if the medium resists the motion with $6 \mathrm{lb}$ of force for each $\mathrm{ft} / \mathrm{sec}$ of velocity.
Find two linearly independent Frobenius solutions of the equation: $9 x^{2} y^{\prime \prime}+3 x\left(1-x^{2}\right) y^{\prime}+\left(1+7 x^{2}\right) y=0$
Find two linearly independent Frobenius solutions of the equation: $x^{2}(1-2 x) y^{\prime \prime}+3 x y^{\prime}+(1+4 x) y=0$
Solve the given homogeneous equation implicitly: $y^{\prime}=\frac{x^{3}+x^{2} y+3 y^{3}}{x^{3}+3 x y^{2}}$
Find the general solution: $\mathbf{y}^{\prime}=\left[\begin{array}{rrr}6 & 0 & -3 \\ -3 & 3 & 3 \\ 1 & -2 & 6\end{array}\right] \mathbf{y}^{\prime}$
gt: $\mathbf{y}=c_{1}\left[\begin{array}{l}1 \\ 2 \\ 1\end{array}\right] e^{3 t}+c_{2} e^{6 t}\left[\begin{array}{r}-\sin 3 t \\ \sin 3 t \\ \cos 3 t\end{array}\right]+c_{3} e^{6 t}\left[\begin{array}{r}\cos 3 t \\ -\cos 3 t \\ \sin 3 t\end{array}\right]$

question: Find the Wronskian of a given set $\left\{y_{1}, y_{2}\right\}$ of solutions of $\left(x^{2}-4\right) y^{\prime \prime}+4 x y^{\prime}+2 y=0$, given that $y_{1}=\frac{1}{x-2}$.
Find a fundamental set of solutions: $4 x^{2} y^{\prime \prime}-4 x y^{\prime}+\left(3-16 x^{2}\right) y=0 ; \quad y_{1}=x^{1 / 2} e^{2 x}$
Find a fundamental set of solutions: $\left(D^{2}+6 D+13\right)(D-2)^{2} D^{3} y=0$
gt: $\left\{e^{-3 x} \cos 2 x, e^{-3 x} \sin 2 x, e^{2 x}, x e^{2 x}, 1, x, x^{2}\right\}$

question: Find the general solution: $y^{\prime \prime}+y^{\prime}=0$
Find a fundamental set of solutions: $x y^{\prime \prime}-(4 x+1) y^{\prime}+(4 x+2) y=0 ; \quad y_{1}=e^{2 x}$

Find the steady state current in the circuit described by the equation.
$\frac{1}{10} Q^{\prime \prime}+6 Q^{\prime}+250 Q=10 \cos 100 t+30 \sin 100 t$

Find a fundamental set of Frobenius solutions for the equation: $12 x^{2}(1+x) y^{\prime \prime}+x\left(11+35 x+3 x^{2}\right) y^{\prime}-\left(1-10 x-5 x^{2}\right) y=0$. Compute $a_{0}, a_{1} \ldots, a_{N}$ for $N$ at least 7 in each solution.

Given the equation $m y^{\prime \prime}+c y^{\prime}+k y=0, \quad y(0)=y_{0}, \quad y^{\prime}(0)=v_{0}$, find the impulse that would have to be applied to the object at $t=\tau$ to put it in equilibrium if $y(\tau)=0$.
gt: $y=(-1)^{k} m \omega_{1} R e^{-c \tau / 2 m} \delta(t-\tau)$ if $\omega_{1} \tau-\phi=(2 k+1) \pi / 2(k=$ integer)

question: Find the general solution: $y^{\prime \prime}+4 x y^{\prime}+\left(4 x^{2}+2\right) y=8 e^{-x(x+2)} ; \quad y_{1}=e^{-x^{2}}$
Solve the given Bernoulli equation: $y^{\prime}+y=y^{2}$
Find a fundamental set of solutions: $\left(4 D^{2}+1\right)^{2}\left(9 D^{2}+4\right)^{3} y=0$
gt: $\{\cos (x / 2), x \cos (x / 2), \sin (x / 2), x \sin (x / 2), \cos 2 x / 3 x \cos (2 x / 3)$, $\left.x^{2} \cos (2 x / 3), \sin (2 x / 3), x \sin (2 x / 3), x^{2} \sin (2 x / 3)\right\}$

question: Find the general solution of the given Euler equation on $(0, \infty)$: $2 x^{2} y^{\prime \prime}+3 x y^{\prime}-y=0$
Find the orthogonal trajectories of the given family of curves: $x^{2}+4 x y+y^{2}=c$

Suppose water is added to a tank at $10 \mathrm{gal} / \mathrm{min}$, but leaks out at the rate of $1 / 5 \mathrm{gal} / \mathrm{min}$ for each gallon in the tank. What is the smallest capacity the tank can have if the process is to continue indefinitely?

Find the steady state current in the circuit described by the equation.
$\frac{1}{10} Q^{\prime \prime}+3 Q^{\prime}+100 Q=5 \cos 10 t-5 \sin 10 t$
Find the general solution: $\mathbf{y}^{\prime}=\left[\begin{array}{rrr}0 & 2 & 1 \\ -4 & 6 & 1 \\ 0 & 4 & 2\end{array}\right] \mathbf{y}$
gt:
\mathbf{y}=c_{1}\left[\begin{array}{r}
-1 \\
-1 \\
2
\end{array}\right]+c_{2}\left[\begin{array}{l}
1 \\
1 \\
2
\end{array}\right] e^{4 t}+c_{3}\left(\left[\begin{array}{l}
0 \\
1 \\
0
\end{array}\right] \frac{e^{4 t}}{2}+\left[\begin{array}{l}
1 \\
1 \\
2
\end{array}\right] t e^{4 t}\right)

question:
Find the steady state current in the circuit described by the equation.
$\frac{1}{20} Q^{\prime \prime}+4 Q^{\prime}+125 Q=15 \cos 30 t-30 \sin 30 t$
Solve the equation explicitly: $y^{\prime}=\frac{y+x}{x}$
Find the general solution: $\mathbf{y}^{\prime}=\left[\begin{array}{rrr}1 & 10 & -12 \\ 2 & 2 & 3 \\ 2 & -1 & 6\end{array}\right] \mathbf{y}$
gt:
\mathbf{y}=c_{1}\left[\begin{array}{r}
-1 \\
1 \\
1
\end{array}\right] e^{3 t}+c_{2}\left(\left[\begin{array}{l}
1 \\
0 \\
0
\end{array}\right] \frac{e^{3 t}}{2}+\left[\begin{array}{r}
-1 \\
1 \\
1
\end{array}\right] t e^{3 t}\right)+c_{3}\left(\left[\begin{array}{l}
1 \\
2 \\
0
\end{array}\right] \frac{e^{3 t}}{36}+\left[\begin{array}{l}
1 \\
0 \\
0
\end{array}\right] \frac{t e^{3 t}}{2}+\left[\begin{array}{r}
-1 \\
1 \\
1
\end{array}\right] \frac{t^{2} e^{3 t}}{2}\right)

question: A 2 gm mass is attached to a spring with constant 20 dyne/cm. Find the steady state component of the displacement if the mass is subjected to an external force $F(t)=3 \cos 4 t-5 \sin 4 t$ dynes and a dashpot supplies 4 dynes of damping for each $\mathrm{cm} / \mathrm{sec}$ of velocity.

A mass of 100 grams stretches a spring $98 \mathrm{~cm}$ in equilibrium. A dashpot attached to the spring supplies a damping force of 600 dynes for each $\mathrm{cm} / \mathrm{sec}$ of speed. The mass is initially displaced 10 $\mathrm{cm}$ above equilibrium and given a downward velocity of $1 \mathrm{~m} / \mathrm{sec}$. Find its displacement for $t>0$.
Find a power series solution $y(x)=\sum_{n=0}^{\infty} a_{n} x^{n}$ for $\left(1+2 x^{2}\right) y^{\prime \prime}+(2-3 x) y^{\prime}+4 y$.

Identical tanks $T_{1}$ and $T_{2}$ initially contain $W$ gallons each of pure water. Starting at $t_{0}=0$, a salt solution with constant concentration $c$ is pumped into $T_{1}$ at $r \mathrm{gal} / \mathrm{min}$ and drained from $T_{1}$ into $T_{2}$ at the same rate. The resulting mixture in $T_{2}$ is also drained at the same rate. Find the concentrations $c_{1}(t)$ and $c_{2}(t)$ in tanks $T_{1}$ and $T_{2}$ for $t>0$.
gt: $c_{1}=c\left(1-e^{-r t / W}\right), c_{2}=c\left(1-e^{-r t / W}-\frac{r}{W} t e^{-r t / W}\right)$.

question: A $64 \mathrm{lb}$ weight is attached to a spring with constant $k=8 \mathrm{lb} / \mathrm{ft}$ and subjected to an external force $F(t)=2 \sin t$. The weight is initially displaced 6 inches above equilibrium and given an upward velocity of $2 \mathrm{ft} / \mathrm{s}$. Find its displacement for $t>0$.
Solve the given Bernoulli equation: $x^{2} y^{\prime}+2 y=2 e^{1 / x} y^{1 / 2}$
Find the general solution: $y^{\prime \prime \prime}+5 y^{\prime \prime}+9 y^{\prime}+5 y=0$
Find $L(u(t-\tau))$.
Find a fundamental set of solutions: $4 x^{2}(\sin x) y^{\prime \prime}-4 x(x \cos x+\sin x) y^{\prime}+(2 x \cos x+3 \sin x) y=0 ; \quad y_{1}=x^{1 / 2}$

Find conditions on the constants $A, B, C$, and $D$ such that the equation
$(A x+B y) d x+(C x+D y) d y=0$
is exact.

Find a fundamental set of Frobenius solutions for the equation: $x\left(3+x+x^{2}\right) y^{\prime \prime}+\left(4+x-x^{2}\right) y^{\prime}+x y=0$. Compute $a_{0}, a_{1} \ldots, a_{N}$ for $N$ at least 7 in each solution.
Find the Wronskian of a given set $\left\{y_{1}, y_{2}\right\}$ of solutions of $(2 x+1) x y^{\prime \prime}-2\left(2 x^{2}-1\right) y^{\prime}-4(x+1) y=0$, given that $y_{1}=\frac{1}{x}$.

Find a fundamental set of Frobenius solutions for the equation: $x^{2}\left(3+3 x+x^{2}\right) y^{\prime \prime}+x\left(5+8 x+7 x^{2}\right) y^{\prime}-\left(1-2 x-9 x^{2}\right) y=0$. Compute $a_{0}, a_{1} \ldots, a_{N}$ for $N$ at least 7 in each solution.
Solve the given homogeneous equation implicitly: $\left(y^{\prime} x-y\right)(\ln |y|-\ln |x|)=x$

A $16 \mathrm{lb}$ weight stretches a spring 6 inches in equilibrium. It is attached to a damping mechanism with constant $c$. Find all values of $c$ such that the free vibration of the weight has infinitely many oscillations.
Find the general solution for the equation: $y^{\prime \prime}+2 y^{\prime}-3 y=-16 x e^{x}$

Experiments indicate that glucose is absorbed by the body at a rate proportional to the amount of glucose present in the bloodstream. Let $\lambda$ denote the (positive) constant of proportionality. Now suppose glucose is injected into a patient's bloodstream at a constant rate of $r$ units per unit of time. Let $G=G(t)$ be the number of units in the patient's bloodstream at time $t>0$. Then

$$
G^{\prime}=-\lambda G+r
$$

where the first term on the right is due to the absorption of the glucose by the patient's body and the second term is due to the injection. Determine $G$ for $t>0$, given that $G(0)=G_{0}$. Also, find $\lim _{t \rightarrow \infty} G(t)$.

Find a fundamental set of Frobenius solutions for the equation: $x^{2}\left(5+x+10 x^{2}\right) y^{\prime \prime}+x\left(4+3 x+48 x^{2}\right) y^{\prime}+\left(x+36 x^{2}\right) y=0$. Compute $a_{0}, a_{1} \ldots, a_{N}$ for $N$ at least 7 in each solution.
Find a fundamental set of solutions: $x y^{\prime \prime}+(2-2 x) y^{\prime}+(x-2) y=0 ; \quad y_{1}=e^{x}$
Find the general solution: $\mathbf{y}^{\prime}=\left[\begin{array}{rrr}-1 & -12 & 8 \\ 1 & -9 & 4 \\ 1 & -6 & 1\end{array}\right] \mathbf{y}$
gt:
\mathbf{y}=c_{1}\left[\begin{array}{r}
-4 \\
0 \\
1
\end{array}\right] e^{-3 t}+c_{2}\left[\begin{array}{l}
6 \\
1 \\
0
\end{array}\right] e^{-3 t}+c_{3}\left(\left[\begin{array}{l}
1 \\
0 \\
0
\end{array}\right] e^{-3 t}+\left[\begin{array}{l}
2 \\
1 \\
1
\end{array}\right] t e^{-3 t}\right)

question: Find a fundamental set of solutions: $(2 x+1) x y^{\prime \prime}-2\left(2 x^{2}-1\right) y^{\prime}-4(x+1) y=0 ; \quad y_{1}=1 / x$
Find the general solution: $4 y^{\prime \prime \prime}-8 y^{\prime \prime}+5 y^{\prime}-y=0$
Find the general solution of the given Euler equation on $(0, \infty)$: $x^{2} y^{\prime \prime}+3 x y^{\prime}+5 y=0$

A $6 \mathrm{lb}$ weight stretches a spring 6 inches in equilibrium. Suppose an external force $F(t)=$ $\frac{3}{16} \sin \omega t+\frac{3}{8} \cos \omega t \mathrm{lb}$ is applied to the weight. For what value of $\omega$ will the displacement be unbounded? Find the displacement if $\omega$ has this value. Assume that the motion starts from equilibrium with zero initial velocity.

Determine which equations are exact and solve them:
1. $6 x^{2} y^{2} d x+4 x^{3} y d y=0$
2. $\left(3 y \cos x+4 x e^{x}+2 x^{2} e^{x}\right) d x+(3 \sin x+3) d y=0$
3. $14 x^{2} y^{3} d x+21 x^{2} y^{2} d y=0$
4. $\left(2 x-2 y^{2}\right) d x+\left(12 y^{2}-4 x y\right) d y=0$
5. $(x+y)^{2} d x+(x+y)^{2} d y=0$
6. $(4 x+7 y) d x+(3 x+4 y) d y=0$
7. $\left(-2 y^{2} \sin x+3 y^{3}-2 x\right) d x+\left(4 y \cos x+9 x y^{2}\right) d y=0$
8. $(2 x+y) d x+(2 y+2 x) d y=0$
9. $\left(3 x^{2}+2 x y+4 y^{2}\right) d x+\left(x^{2}+8 x y+18 y\right) d y=0$
10. $\left(2 x^{2}+8 x y+y^{2}\right) d x+\left(2 x^{2}+x y^{3} / 3\right) d y=0$
11. $\left(\frac{1}{x}+2 x\right) d x+\left(\frac{1}{y}+2 y\right) d y=0$
12. $\left(y \sin x y+x y^{2} \cos x y\right) d x+\left(x \sin x y+x y^{2} \cos x y\right) d y=0$
13. $\frac{x d x}{\left(x^{2}+y^{2}\right)^{3 / 2}}+\frac{y d y}{\left(x^{2}+y^{2}\right)^{3 / 2}}=0$
14. $\left(e^{x}\left(x^{2} y^{2}+2 x y^{2}\right)+6 x\right) d x+\left(2 x^{2} y e^{x}+2\right) d y=0$
15. $\left(x^{2} e^{x^{2}+y}\left(2 x^{2}+3\right)+4 x\right) d x+\left(x^{3} e^{x^{2}+y}-12 y^{2}\right) d y=0$
16. $\left(e^{x y}\left(x^{4} y+4 x^{3}\right)+3 y\right) d x+\left(x^{5} e^{x y}+3 x\right) d y=0$
17. $\left(3 x^{2} \cos x y-x^{3} y \sin x y+4 x\right) d x+\left(8 y-x^{4} \sin x y\right) d y=0$

A $10 \mathrm{~kg}$ mass stretches a spring $70 \mathrm{~cm}$ in equilibrium. Suppose a $2 \mathrm{~kg}$ mass is attached to the spring, initially displaced $25 \mathrm{~cm}$ below equilibrium, and given an upward velocity of $2 \mathrm{~m} / \mathrm{s}$. Find its displacement for $t>0$. Find the frequency, period, amplitude, and phase angle of the motion.
Solve the equation using variation of parameters followed by separation of variables: $y^{\prime}-2 y=\frac{x e^{2 x}}{1-y e^{-2 x}}$

A $96 \mathrm{lb}$ weight is dropped from rest in a medium that exerts a resistive force with magnitude proportional to the speed. Find its velocity as a function of time if its terminal velocity is $-128 \mathrm{ft} / \mathrm{s}$.

A space vehicle is to be launched from the moon, which has a radius of about 1080 miles. The acceleration due to gravity at the surface of the moon is about $5.31 \mathrm{ft} / \mathrm{s}^{2}$. Find the escape velocity in miles/s.
Find the general solution: $x y^{\prime}+3 y=0$
A space probe is to be launched from a space station 200 miles above Earth. Determine its escape velocity in miles/s. Take Earth's radius to be 3960 miles.
Find a power series solution $y(x)=\sum_{n=0}^{\infty} a_{n} x^{n}$ for $(2+x) y^{\prime \prime}+x y^{\prime}+3 y$.
Find a fundamental set of solutions: $x y^{\prime \prime}-(4 x+1) y^{\prime}+(4 x+2) y=0 ; \quad y_{1}=e^{2 x}$
Find the general solution: $x y^{\prime}+3 y=0$
Find the general solution: $y^{\prime \prime \prime}+2 y^{\prime \prime}+y^{\prime}=-2 e^{-x}\left(7-18 x+6 x^{2}\right)$
Find a curve $y=y(x)$ through $(1,-1)$ such that the tangent to the curve at any point $\left(x_{0}, y\left(x_{0}\right)\right)$ intersects the $y$ axis at $y_{I}=x_{0}^{3}$.
Solve the equation using variation of parameters followed by separation of variables: $x y^{\prime}-2 y=\frac{x^{6}}{y+x^{2}}$
Find a fundamental set of solutions: $\left(D^{2}+1\right)\left(D^{2}+9\right)^{2}(D-2) y=0$
gt: $\left\{\cos x, \sin x, \cos 3 x, x \cos 3 x, \sin 3 x, x \sin 3 x, e^{2 x}\right\}$

question: Find two linearly independent Frobenius solutions of the equation: $x^{2}(1-x) y^{\prime \prime}-x(3-5 x) y^{\prime}+(4-5 x) y=0$
Find the general solution: $x^{2} y^{\prime \prime}-x(2 x-1) y^{\prime}+\left(x^{2}-x-1\right) y=x^{2} e^{x} ; \quad y_{1}=x e^{x}$
Find the Wronskian of a given set $\left\{y_{1}, y_{2}\right\}$ of solutions of $(3 x-1) y^{\prime \prime}-(3 x+2) y^{\prime}-(6 x-8) y=0$, given that $y_{1}=e^{2 x}$.
Find the general solution: $\mathbf{y}^{\prime}=\left[\begin{array}{ll}-11 & 4 \\ -26 & 9\end{array}\right] \mathbf{y}$
gt:
$\mathbf{y}=c_{1} e^{-t}\left[\begin{array}{c}
5 \cos 2 t+\sin 2 t \\
13 \cos 2 t
\end{array}\right]+c_{2} e^{-t}\left[\begin{array}{c}
5 \sin 2 t-\cos 2 t \\
13 \sin 2 t
\end{array}\right]$

question: Find the general solution: $\mathbf{y}^{\prime}=\left[\begin{array}{rrr}3 & -4 & -2 \\ -5 & 7 & -8 \\ -10 & 13 & -8\end{array}\right] \mathbf{y}$
gt: $\mathbf{y}=c_{1}\left[\begin{array}{l}2 \\ 2 \\ 1\end{array}\right] e^{-2 t}+c_{2} e^{2 t}\left[\begin{array}{c}-\cos 3 t-\sin 3 t \\ -\sin 3 t \\ \cos 3 t\end{array}\right]+c_{3} e^{2 t}\left[\begin{array}{c}-\sin 3 t+\cos 3 t \\ \cos 3 t \\ \sin 3 t\end{array}\right]$

question: Find all curves $y=y(x)$ such that the tangent to the curve at any point $\left(x_{0}, y\left(x_{0}\right)\right)$ intersects the $y$ axis at $y_{I}=x_{0}$.

A $96 \mathrm{lb}$ weight stretches a spring $3.2 \mathrm{ft}$ in equilibrium. It is attached to a dashpot with damping constant $c=18 \mathrm{lb}-\mathrm{sec} / \mathrm{ft}$. The weight is initially displaced 15 inches below equilibrium and given a downward velocity of $12 \mathrm{ft} / \mathrm{sec}$. Find its displacement for $t>0$.
Find the general solution: $x^{2} y^{\prime \prime}-3 x y^{\prime}+4 y=4 x^{4} ; \quad y_{1}=x^{2}$
Find the general solution: $x y^{\prime}+(\ln x) y=0$

An $8 \mathrm{lb}$ weight stretches a spring 8 inches in equilibrium. It is attached to a dashpot with damping constant $c=.5 \mathrm{lb}-\mathrm{sec} / \mathrm{ft}$ and subjected to an external force $F(t)=4 \cos 2 t \mathrm{lb}$. Determine the steady state component of the displacement for $t>0$.
Solve the given homogeneous equation implicitly: $y^{\prime}=\frac{y^{3}+2 x y^{2}+x^{2} y+x^{3}}{x(y+x)^{2}}$
Find the general solution of the given Euler equation on $(0, \infty)$: $12 x^{2} y^{\prime \prime}-5 x y^{\prime \prime}+6 y=0$
Find the general solution: $\mathbf{y}^{\prime}=\left[\begin{array}{ll}-1 & 2 \\ -5 & 5\end{array}\right] \mathbf{y}$
gt:
$\mathbf{y}=c_{1} e^{2 t}\left[\begin{array}{c}
3 \cos t+\sin t \\
5 \cos t
\end{array}\right]+c_{2} e^{2 t}\left[\begin{array}{c}
3 \sin t-\cos t \\
5 \sin t
\end{array}\right]$

question: Find the general solution for the equation: $y^{\prime \prime}+6 y^{\prime}+9 y=e^{2 x}(3-5 x)$
A unit mass hangs in equilibrium from a spring with constant $k=1 / 16$. Starting at $t=0$, a force $F(t)=3 \sin t$ is applied to the mass. Find its displacement for $t>0$.
Two identical objects suspended from different springs are set into motion. The period of one motion is 3 times the period of the other. How are the two spring constants related?
gt: $k_{1}=9 k_{2}$, where $k_{1}$ is the spring constant of the system with the shorter period.

question: The population $P=P(t)$ of a species satisfies the logistic equation: $P^{\prime}=a P(1-\alpha P)$ and $P(0)=P_{0}>0$. Find $P$ for $t>0$, and find $\lim _{t \rightarrow \infty} P(t)$.

A $32 \mathrm{lb}$ weight stretches a spring $1 \mathrm{ft}$ in equilibrium. It is attached to a dashpot with constant $c=12 \mathrm{lb}-\mathrm{sec} / \mathrm{ft}$. The weight is initially displaced 8 inches above equilibrium and released from rest. Find its displacement for $t>0$.
Find a fundamental set of solutions: $\left(4 D^{2}+4 D+9\right)^{3} y=0$
gt: $\left\{e^{-x / 2} \cos 2 x, x e^{-x / 2} \cos 2 x, x^{2} e^{-x / 2} \cos 2 x, e^{-x / 2} \sin 2 x, x e^{-x / 2} \sin 2 x\right.$, $\left.x^{2} e^{-x / 2} \sin 2 x\right\}$

question: Find the general solution: $y^{\prime \prime \prime}-6 y^{\prime \prime}+11 y^{\prime}-6 y=e^{2 x}\left(5-4 x-3 x^{2}\right)$

A weight stretches a spring 1.5 inches in equilibrium. The weight is initially displaced 8 inches above equilibrium and given a downward velocity of $4 \mathrm{ft} / \mathrm{s}$. Find its displacement for $t>0$.
Find the Wronskian of a given set $\left\{y_{1}, y_{2}\right\}$ of solutions of $x^{2} y^{\prime \prime}-x y^{\prime}+y=0$, given that $y_{1}=x$.

A 200 gallon tank initially contains 100 gallons of water with 20 pounds of salt. A salt solution with $1 / 4$ pound of salt per gallon is added to the tank at $4 \mathrm{gal} / \mathrm{min}$, and the resulting mixture is drained out at $2 \mathrm{gal} / \mathrm{min}$. Find the quantity of salt in the tank as it's about to overflow.
Find the general solution: $y^{(4)}+12 y^{\prime \prime}+36 y=0$

A spring-mass system has natural frequency $7 \sqrt{10} \mathrm{rad} / \mathrm{s}$. The natural length of the spring is $.7 \mathrm{~m}$. What is the length of the spring when the mass is in equilibrium?
Find a fundamental set of solutions: $\left[(D-1)^{4}-16\right] y=0$
gt: $\left\{e^{-x}, e^{3 x}, e^{x} \cos 2 x, e^{x} \sin 2 x\right\}$

question: A 1200-gallon tank initially contains 40 pounds of salt dissolved in 600 gallons of water. Starting at $t_{0}=0$, water that contains $1 / 2$ pound of salt per gallon is added to the tank at the rate of 6 $\mathrm{gal} / \mathrm{min}$ and the resulting mixture is drained from the tank at $4 \mathrm{gal} / \mathrm{min}$. Find the quantity $Q(t)$ of salt in the tank at any time $t>0$ prior to overflow.
Find the general solution: $\mathbf{y}^{\prime}=\left[\begin{array}{rr}-7 & 4 \\ -1 & -11\end{array}\right] \mathbf{y}$
Find the general solution: $y^{\prime \prime}-2 y^{\prime}+y=7 x^{3 / 2} e^{x} ; \quad y_{1}=e^{x}$
Find the general solution of the given Euler equation on $(0, \infty)$: $x^{2} y^{\prime \prime}-7 x y^{\prime}+7 y=0$
Find the Wronskian of a given set $\left\{y_{1}, y_{2}\right\}$ of solutions of $4 x^{2} y^{\prime \prime}-4 x y^{\prime}+\left(3-16 x^{2}\right) y=0$, given that $y_{1}=x^{1 / 2} e^{2 x}$.
Find a power series solution $y(x)=\sum_{n=0}^{\infty} a_{n} x^{n}$ for $\left(1+3 x^{2}\right) y^{\prime \prime}+3 x^{2} y^{\prime}-2 y$.
Find the general solution: $y^{\prime \prime \prime}+y^{\prime \prime}-2 y=-e^{3 x}\left(9+67 x+17 x^{2}\right)$
Find the orthogonal trajectories of the given family of curves: $x^{2}+2 y^{2}=c^{2}$
Find the general solution: $6 y^{(4)}+5 y^{\prime \prime \prime}+7 y^{\prime \prime}+5 y^{\prime}+y=0$
Find the general solution: $\mathbf{y}^{\prime}=\left[\begin{array}{rrr}5 & -1 & 1 \\ -1 & 9 & -3 \\ -2 & 2 & 4\end{array}\right] \mathbf{y}$
gt:
\mathbf{y}=c_{1}\left[\begin{array}{l}
0 \\
1 \\
1
\end{array}\right] e^{6 t}+c_{2}\left(\left[\begin{array}{r}
-1 \\
1 \\
0
\end{array}\right] \frac{e^{6 t}}{4}+\left[\begin{array}{l}
0 \\
1 \\
1
\end{array}\right] t e^{6 t}\right)+c_{3}\left(\left[\begin{array}{l}
1 \\
1 \\
0
\end{array}\right] \frac{e^{6 t}}{8}+\left[\begin{array}{r}
-1 \\
1 \\
0
\end{array}\right] \frac{t e^{6 t}}{4}+\left[\begin{array}{l}
0 \\
1 \\
